In 1979 she founded with her husband, Ponchiarello â€“ men’s clothing factory, focusing on the wholesale and retail business. Two years after its foundation, they decided to expand their business and started manufacturing and selling uniforms for companies. That decision led them to develop their business on a large scale. Today, Ponchiarello, after more than 30 years, is still on the market, run by her husband and son.

Her first important challenge at corporative level was in Siemens, where she developed an important success in the Sales area as a Sales Manager. In 1992 she became Marketing and Customer Service Manager for Mercado Magazine, the biggest economics and business magazine in Argentina. There, she changed the way a relationship program should be developed and implemented for a business target.

In 2001 she was headhunted by McCann Erickson Group to manage MRM Argentinaâ€™s direct and relationship marketing area. In 2004 she was appointed CEO, two years later she became Regional Director for Latin America.

Thanks to her academic background as a professor on executive programs, at both national and international levels, Marta has had the opportunity to get to know many Latin American countries in detail. This has added great depth and scope to her vision on this market, allowing her to win accounts such as HP, Intel, GM, Hilton Hotel, Nortel and MasterCard - all of whom MRM currently works with at a regional level.

At the same time she managed to create a joint venture with a digital company named Inetlligent, which has allowed MRM Argentina to provide digital services within the country and overseas. In 2007, MRM Worldwide completed a successful acquisition of this digital company and converted MRM Argentina into a full-service operations office and one of the most acknowledged creative agencies in the region.

In 2009 she became a co-founder of Nextperience, a digital agency base on â€œideas and performanceâ€, focus on the local, regional an worldwide market.

Graduated in Business Administration at University of Buenos Aires, Marta is specialized in Direct Marketing. She has also taken post-graduate studies in the IAE and is currently focusing on continuously updating her digital marketing skills. Marta also fills academic roles, as a lecturer at ADEN Business School, in their Direct, Relationship and Digital Marketing courses for Latin American executives, and is an honorary professor of Direct and Relationship Marketing Post Graduate Studies at the University of San Andres, Buenos Aires, Argentina.

Additionally, she is VP in AMDIA (Argentinean Interactive and Direct Marketing Association).
